treasury_media.title: Fourteen TU Delft researchers awarded the Veni grant
treasury_media.description: The Dutch Research Council (NWO) has made 162 recent PhD researchers happy with a Veni grant of EUR 250,000 for three years. Fourteen of them are associated with TU Delft.

projects.title: Solar Powered Parking Lots for charging of EV and PHEV
projects.description:
This project was implementeted during the course Smart Energy Products. We attempt to expand the market for photovoltaic systems while in the same 
time we minimize the effect of the growing market of EV on the grid while incorporating gam-
ification techniques for strengthening consumers’ acceptance. In simple words our solution 
is the use of PV systems as shading infrastructure on parking lots, for charging electric vehi-
cles. It is a complete solution, from the hardware selected to the control theory followed and 
the cloud based dispatching technology for incorporating the gamification techniques based 
on our smart phone and web app. Our innovative system will be provided to companies with 
outdoor parking space. The added value of such an adaptation includes among others: electric 
car owner preference, revenue from parking and charging their vehicles, revenue from selling 
the excess energy produced to the grid or personal use. On top of the immediate benefits of 
such a system, the company is investing drastically in the future by slowly forming a recog-
nizable, "environmental friendly" name that values high the principles of corporate social re-
sponsibility. This long term investment will slowly be converted in popularity and preference 
among environmentally aware consumers

contributors.headline: Postdoctoral Researcher, Project Leader and Veni Laureate (NWO - Grant)
MSc at TU Delft | Mechanical Engineer at HELLENIC PETROLEUM Group of Companies

projects.title: System Integration Project
projects.description:
The objective of this project was to create an autonomous hybrid system based on renewable energy sources (primary solar, secondary hydrogen via fuel cell)  for a specific case of households and energy demand. Furthermore, battery storage was implemented along with an electrolyser, compressor and tank to produce and store hydrogen fuel on-site. The whole system along the dynamics of the components were simulated in MATLAB/SIMULINK models combined with a separate economic analysis.

In order to control the frequency a grid was also connected to the system. Ultimately, by sizing correctly our system to match the demand, the grid contribution should go to zero. That means that the grid will neither support nor be fed with power and its only role will be to keep a fixed frequency. In other words, the grid will be used as an indicator that our system is completely autonomous.

contributors.headline: Postdoctoral Researcher, Project Leader and Veni Laureate (NWO - Grant)

projects.title: PV in Greece
projects.description:
This project was implementeted during the course System Innovation and Strategic Niche Management.  Photovoltaic systems are an emerging technology that can play an important role to our modern societies. This is an innovating method of generating electrical power by converting solar radiation into current using semiconductor material that exhibit photovoltaic effect. The importance of the above technology is maximized for a Mediterranean country with high irradiation level such as Greece. In that project was analyzed the  current state of development of photovoltaic applications in Greece and how can today’s market be strengthened even while in an economic crisis. For this scope FIS analysis was applied as well as a Landscape and Regime analysis. 

The main result of our research was that Greece has many prospect for PV installation and energy production from solar despite the economic crysis. Although, many changes and improvements should be taken off in order a huge increase in PV installations to be maintained,

contributors.headline: Postdoctoral Researcher, Project Leader and Veni Laureate (NWO - Grant)

projects.title: The use of motion picture in teaching
projects.description:
During my practical training in “Teaching Physics” I was assigned with the task of analysing the use of motion picture in teaching. I filmed and presented an instructive video titled “Vibrations of an amusement park’s cot” along with a 2 hour presentation on “Vibrations”.

During the same course I adapted with the procedure of shooting a physics lesson as an operator as well as the operation of console for the live composition of picture

Grade 10/10

profile_positions.description: The position includes multicultural activities to enable new master students in the Netherlands, extra role - Driver.  More specifically, team project supervision and guidance, library and campus tours, survival activities that include food, health, groceries, bicycles, trips to nearby cities and sports. Last but not least, as indicated by the extra role, I was also driving new students to their new homes.
